attributes.action: Restrict the movement of quarry vehicles during school drop-off and pick-up times at St Brendan's School, Harwood, Bolton.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The safety of young children is being put at serious risk by fully laden quarry vehicles on a narrow access road to a busy Bolton primary school at pick-up and drop-off times. At the busiest times there can be more than 25 20-ton lorries blocking the school lane and the junction to the main Hardy Mill Road which is a designated crossing area. Lorries have been mounting the pavement in this area. We would like to work with the quarry owners James Booth to reach a workable compromise that would keep lorries and children apart at the busiest periods of the day. If this isn't achieved the probability of a serious accident or fatality is extremely high.
